questions.question: What is the primary purpose of conducting a compression strength test on moulding sand? (LO1)

answers.b: To evaluate the ability of sand to resist compressive forces
answers.c: To measure the thermal conductivity of the sand
answers.d: To check the grain size distribution

explanations.a: Compression strength testing ensures that the moulding sand can withstand the forces exerted by molten metal without collapsing. If the sand has low compressive strength, the mould may deform or crack, leading to casting defects. Higher compression strength means better load-bearing capability, ensuring the stability of the mould during metal pouring.

questions.question: What is the standard method of compacting the sand mixture in the compression strength test? (LO2)

answers.b: By manually pressing it into a mould
answers.c: By ramming the sand with a sand rammer

explanations.a: A sand rammer is used to apply uniform pressure to the sand specimen, ensuring consistent density and strength. This process eliminates air gaps and provides accurate test results. If the sand is not compacted properly, it may produce weak moulds that cannot withstand metal casting pressures.

questions.question: What equipment is used to measure the shear strength of sand specimens? (LO2)

explanations.a: The universal sand testing machine applies controlled force to the sand specimen until failure occurs. questions.question: How is shear strength determined from the universal sand testing machine? (LO2)

answers.a: By checking the temperature resistance of the specimen
answers.b: By reading the force applied until the specimen ruptures
answers.d: By measuring the weight of the sand specimen

explanations.a: The universal sand testing machine gradually applies force to the specimen until it breaks. The reading at which rupture occurs is the shear strength, indicating the sand's ability to withstand mechanical stresses.
